lg.l: Sr
Delany reports it, & he has a shrewd Tongue;
That we both act the part of the Clowns & yẹ Cow dung:
We ly cramming our Selves & are ready to burst,
Yet still are no wiser than we were at first.
Pudet hæc Opprobria I freely must tell ye,
Et dici potuisse & non potuisse refelli.
Tho' Delany advis'd You to plague me no longer,
You reply and rejoyn like Hoadly of Bangor.
I must now at one Sitting pay off my old Score:
How many to answer? here's one, two, three, four.
But because the three former are long ago past
I shall for Method's Sake begin with the last.
You treat me like a Boy that knocks down his Foe,
Who e'r t'other gets up demands one rising Blow.
Yet I knew a young Rogue that thrown flat on the Field,
Would as he lay under cry out, Sirrah yield.
So the French when our Generalls soundly did pay 'um
Went triumphant to Church & Sang Stoutly Te Deum.
So the famous Tom Leigh when quite run a ground,
Comes off by outlaughing the Company round.
In ev'ry vile Pamphlet youl read the Same Fancies,
Having thus overthrown all our Author advances.
My Offers of Peace you ill understood.
Friend Sheridan when will you know your own Good?
'Twas to teach you in modester Language your Duty,
For were you a Dog I could not be rude t' ye.
As a good honest Soul, who no mischief intends,
To a quarrelsom Fellow cryes, Let us be friends.
But we like Antæus & Hercules fight,
The ofter you fall, the ofter you write.
And I'll use you as he did that overgrown Clown,
I'll first take you up, and then take you down.
And 'tis your own Case for you never can wound
The worst Dunce in your School, till he's heav'd from the Ground.
I beg Your Pardon for using my left hand, but I was in great hast, and the other Hand was employ'd at the Same time in writing Some Letters of Business.
Sept. 20tḥ 1718.
||I will send You the rest when I have Leasure, but pray come to dinner wtḥ the Company You met here last.
